refnamediv.refpurpose: service-side interface for the Tubes channel type

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Signals
refsect1.synopsis: "d-bus-names-changed" : Run Last / Has Details "new-tube" : Run Last / Has Details "stream-tube-new-connection" : Run Last / Has Details "tube-closed" : Run Last / Has Details "tube-state-changed" : Run Last / Has Details

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: A "tube" is a mechanism for arbitrary data transfer. This section documents the auto-generated C wrappers for the Tubes channel type.

refsect2.title: TpSvcChannelTypeTubes
refsect2.para: Dummy typedef representing any implementation of this interface.

refsect2.title: TpSvcChannelTypeTubesClass
refsect2.para: The class of TpSvcChannelTypeTubes.
In a full implementation of this interface (i.e. all methods implemented), the interface initialization function used in G_IMPLEMENT_INTERFACE() would typically look like this:

refsect2.title: tp_svc_channel_type_tubes_accept_d_bus_tube_impl ()
refsect2.para: The signature of an implementation of the D-Bus method AcceptDBusTube on interface org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Channel.Type.Tubes.

listitem.simpara: Used to return values or throw an error

refsect2.title: tp_svc_channel_type_tubes_implement_accept_d_bus_tube ()
refsect2.para: Register an implementation for the AcceptDBusTube method in the vtable of an implementation of this interface. To be called from the interface init function.

listitem.simpara: A class whose instances implement this interface
A callback used to implement the AcceptDBusTube D-Bus method

refsect2.title: tp_svc_channel_type_tubes_return_from_accept_d_bus_tube ()
refsect2.para: Return successfully by calling dbus_g_method_return(). This inline function exists only to provide type-safety.
